snippet: Mr. Africa, who was serving a 30- to 100-year sentence for killing a police officer, was in prison at the time of Move’s best-known episode, a 1985 siege that ended when the state police dropped a bomb, touching off the worst fire in...
abstract: Phil Africa, a high-ranking member of the Philadelphia-based black-liberation group Move who was serving life sentence for killing police officer, dies at age 59.
lead_paragraph: Mr. Africa, who was serving a 30- to 100-year sentence for killing a police officer, was in prison at the time of Move’s best-known episode, a 1985 siege that ended when the state police dropped a bomb, touching off the worst fire in Philadelphia’s history.

headline.main: Phil Africa, of Black-Liberation Group Move, Long in Prison, Dies at 59
headline.print_headline: Phil Africa, 59, of Black-Liberation Group Move, Long in Prison
